messages.content: What is the purpose of ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools?
ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools is a package that provides custom nodes for ComfyUI to perform transcription tasks on audio and video file inputs, especially suited for long duration inputs.
Does ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools support multiple languages?
Yes, ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools includes multi-language support for transcription tasks.
Is batch processing of files possible with ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools?
Yes, ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools allows batch processing of many files at once.
Is the 'To text (Debug)' node part of ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools?
No, the 'To text (Debug)' node is part of Derfuu_ModdedNodes, not ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools.
Where can I find example workflows for ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools?
Example workflows for ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools can be found in the 'docs/workflows.md' file.
Where can I find information about the nodes provided by ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools?
Information about the nodes provided by ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools can be found in the 'docs/nodes.md' file.
Where can I find information about the supported transcription models in ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools?
Information about the supported transcription models in ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools can be found in the 'docs/models.md' file.
Who provided instrumental examples for the development of ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools?
The team supporting ComfyUI-VideoHelperSuite provided instrumental examples for the development of ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools.
What is ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools?
ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools is a custom node or plugin for ComfyUI that provides transcription functionality using various models.
Where are the transcription models used by ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools stored?
The transcription models used by ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools are stored in the ~/.cache/huggingface/hub directory.
From where are the transcription models for ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools downloaded?
The transcription models for ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools are downloaded from the Hugging Face Model Hub.
Which openai/whisper model versions are supported by ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools?

ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools supports openai/whisper-large-v3, openai/whisper-large-v2, openai/whisper-large, openai/whisper-medium, openai/whisper-small, openai/whisper-base, and openai/whisper-tiny versions.
Does ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools support English-only models?
Yes, ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools supports English-only models such as openai/whisper-medium.en, openai/whisper-small.en, openai/whisper-base.en, and openai/whisper-tiny.en.
Are the transcription models in ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools automatically downloaded?
Yes, the transcription models in ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools are automatically downloaded at runtime.
What is the URL for the Hugging Face Model Hub?
The URL for the Hugging Face Model Hub is https://huggingface.co/models.
What is the purpose of the Load Audio node in ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools?
The Load Audio node in ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools is used to load an audio file from the `input/` folder.
How can you load the audio component of a video file using ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools?
You can load the audio component of a video file using the Load Audio from Video node in ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools.
What types of files can be selected using the Load Audio from Batch node in ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools?

The Load Audio from Batch node in ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools can select audio files and video files simultaneously from the input folder or any arbitrary path on the system. It also supports regex filtering for file selection.
What does the Load Whisper Model node in ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools do?
The Load Whisper Model node in ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools creates a new whisper pipeline to transcribe audio and supports selecting the input language.
What is the purpose of the Whisper Transcribe node in ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools?
The Whisper Transcribe node in ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools is used to transcribe the audio using the whisper model. It includes options for saving files to the `output/transcription` folder.
How can you transcribe a batch of audio files using ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools?
You can transcribe a batch of audio files using the Whisper Transcribe Batch node in ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools. It includes options for saving files to the `output/transcription` folder.
What is the purpose of the Audio Sink node in ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools?
The Audio Sink node in ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools saves wav_bytes to a file in the `output/audio` folder. It was created for debugging purposes.
What does the Convert VHS Audio to WAV bytes node in ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools do?

The Convert VHS Audio to WAV bytes node in ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools converts audio from Video Helper Suite (VHS) audio type to wav_bytes type. This conversion is necessary due to the way ComfyUI handles type checking.
What is the purpose of the Single Transcribe workflow in ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools?
The Single Transcribe workflow in ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools loads audio or video files from the `input/` folder and saves the transcription to the `output/transcriptions` folder.
Where can the configuration file for the Single Transcribe workflow be found?
The configuration file for the Single Transcribe workflow can be found at `../workflows/single_transcribe.json`.
What is the purpose of the Batch Transcribe workflow in ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools?
The Batch Transcribe workflow in ComfyUI-TranscriptionTools loads audio and video files from the selected folder and saves the transcriptions to the `output/transcriptions` folder.
Where can folders be selected from for the Batch Transcribe workflow?
Folders may be selected relative to the `input/` or the system root for the Batch Transcribe workflow.
Where can the configuration file for the Batch Transcribe workflow be found?
The configuration file for the Batch Transcribe workflow can be found at `../workflows/batch_transcribe.json`.
Is there a visual representation available for the Single Transcribe workflow?
Yes, there is a visual representation available for the Single Transcribe workflow, which can be found at `../workflows/single_transcribe.jpg`.
Is there a visual representation available for the Batch Transcribe workflow?
Yes, there is a visual representation available for the Batch Transcribe workflow, which can be found at `../workflows/batch_transcribe.jpg`.
